Summary: 5 orange and yellow lights stationary in the western sky, random pattern, lite up for 5-7 seconds.
divs: sighting detailsme and 2 of my friends were sitting on a bench in front of my tattoo shop on wrightsboro rd having a conversation about rc cars. one of my friends also works for me here at the shop. last week he told a few of us at the shop that he had seen some orange\yellow lights in the sky last tuesday night. we laughed it off as a plane or shooting star. as we were talking tonight he yelled out "look! look in the sky over there, there it is, the lights i saw last week"! me and my other friend looked up at the sky to find the "lights". it took 1-2 seconds and we saw them. 5 clustered orange\yellowish lights were lite up for 5-7 seconds. then thy dimmed out, not fast but not slow. at first i thought it was fireworks but they didn't dim out like fireworks do nor were they falling. they stayed in the same spot for around 8-10 seconds total. about 10 seconds after they were gone they appeared again in the sky but a lot father away than first time? they were only lit for a few seconds that time. we tried to explain it to each other and figure out what it was but can not come to a logical explanation as to what it could have been. my friend called the news station the first time it happened and was told they would look into it. nothing came of it. i told him to call them again and tell them we all saw the lights tonight. they told him that they had several other calls about the same lights we saw tonight and that they would be coming to interview us tomorrow. both times that the lights were seen were on tuesdays at or around 8pm. the light looked like they were around 10-15 miles away from us.
trends: There have been 20 other sightings in Augusta
There was one other sighting in Augusta on or around March 17th 2009
